edu.cpp.cs.cs141.class_project

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.class_project.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class controls all game specific mechanics and interactions between objects in the game. It controls player and enemy actions aswell.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean alive
      A variable for keeping track of whether or not the player is alive.
      private boolean debug
      A variable for keeping track of whether or not the game is being debugged or played If this is true, the game enters a debugging mode, where all the objects within the grid can be seen.
      private int direction
      Determines what direction the player is facing 1) up 2) down 3) left 4) right The player can only see in the direction they are facing
      private VisualGame gamer
      An object that encapsulates the multiple parts of the GUI.
      private Grid grid
      This is the 2 dimensional array that the player is traversing through The array keeps track of the location of all objects within the array.
      private boolean gui
      Determines if the gui is running or not.
      private Gun gun
      The gun that the player is holding.
      private boolean hardMode
      A variable for keeping track of the difficulty of the game.
      private boolean hasLooked
      Determines whether or not the player has looked already or not The player cannot look again until this variable is false;
      private boolean hasMoved
      determines whether or not the player has moved A player cannot move when this is false
      private boolean hasRadar
      Determines if the player has a radar If the player has a radar, they know the location of the exit.
      private int invincible
      The number of turns that the player is invincible.
      private GUIMessage message
      The class responsible creating pop up messages.
      private UserInterface userI
      This class allows the user to interact with the game.
      private boolean win
      A variable for keeping track of whether or not the player has won.

      A method that changes the direction that player is looking.
      void lookGui()
      A method that is used for changing the direction the player is looking for the GUI If the player has already looked then they will get a warning message
      void playerMove(int choice)
      A method that chooses allows the player to move in one direction once hasMoved will become true if the player was able to move The player cannot move through walls or out of bounds.
      void respawn()
      A method that causes the player to respawn back at [8][0] The player will also lose a life and will be informed of this loss.
      void setDebug(boolean mod)
      A setter method that allows the player to toggle debug mode When true, debug mode will be on and the player can see the whole map When false, player can only see 2 spaces in the direction that they are looking.

      A setter method for the private variable gui This allows other objects to set the status of gui When gui is true, the gui will appear When the gui is false, the text based interface will appear.

      A setter method that allows the user to change the difficulty.

      A setter method that allows altercation to the private variable hasLooked This allows other objects (specifically the GUI) to change the status of hasLooked

      Kills an enemy if the enemy is shot The player is prompted to shoot in a certain direction as well.
      void shootDown()
      Checks for an enemy in the same column and to the below of your current location Shoots and kills the enemy if there is an enemy
      void shootLeft()
      Checks for an enemy in the same row and to the left of your current location Shoots and kills the enemy if there is an enemy

      Checks for an enemy in the same row and to the right of your current location Shoots and kills the enemy if there is an enemy
      void shootUp()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • gamer

        private VisualGame gamer
        An object that encapsulates the multiple parts of the GUI. By placing those parts in one class, it is easier to avoid stackoverflow errors due to indirect recursion

      • message

        private GUIMessage message
        The class responsible creating pop up messages. These messages contain warnings for when the player tries to make an illegal move. They also contain bits of information for when the player picks up power-ups

      • grid

        private Grid grid
        This is the 2 dimensional array that the player is traversing through The array keeps track of the location of all objects within the array.

      • userI

        private UserInterface userI
        This class allows the user to interact with the game. The userInterface is also responsible for any output text that is printer on to the console.

      • hasMoved

        private boolean hasMoved
        determines whether or not the player has moved A player cannot move when this is false

      • direction

        private int direction
        Determines what direction the player is facing 1) up 2) down 3) left 4) right The player can only see in the direction they are facing

      • hasLooked

        private boolean hasLooked
        Determines whether or not the player has looked already or not The player cannot look again until this variable is false;

      • gun

        private Gun gun
        The gun that the player is holding. This gun starts off with one ammo and loses one ammo every time it is fired. The gun can be reloaded if the player finds a bullet The gun cannot shoot when it has no ammo.

      • invincible

        private int invincible
        The number of turns that the player is invincible. While this number is greater than zero, the player cannot die.

      • win

        private boolean win
        A variable for keeping track of whether or not the player has won. The player cannot perform any actions if they win.

      • alive

        private boolean alive
        A variable for keeping track of whether or not the player is alive. The player cannot perform any actions if they are not alive.

      • hardMode

        private boolean hardMode
        A variable for keeping track of the difficulty of the game. If hardMode is true, the enemy gain an AI and will chase the player when they are in the same row or column

      • debug

        private boolean debug
        A variable for keeping track of whether or not the game is being debugged or played If this is true, the game enters a debugging mode, where all the objects within the grid can be seen. The exit is also visible.

      • hasRadar

        private boolean hasRadar
        Determines if the player has a radar If the player has a radar, they know the location of the exit.

      • gui

        private boolean gui
        Determines if the gui is running or not. If the gui is running, pop-up messages will appear instead of text on the console A graohical representation of the grid will also be shown instead of a text based one

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        The default constructor for the GameEngine class. The constructor creates all of the private objects. All of the booleans are set to false, except gui and alive which are set to true. Direction is also initialized as 1 instead of 0;

    • Method Detail

      • isGui

        public boolean isGui()
        A getter method for the private variable gui This allows other objects to determine whether or not the gui is currently showing
        Returns:
        whether or not the gui is on or off

      • setGui

        public void setGui(boolean gui)
        A setter method for the private variable gui This allows other objects to set the status of gui When gui is true, the gui will appear When the gui is false, the text based interface will appear.
        Parameters:
        gui - sets whether or not the gui is on or off

      • getVisualGame

        public VisualGame getVisualGame()
        A getter method for the private variable VisualGrid This allows other classes to access methods that are within the VisualGame through GameEngine
        Returns:
        the gui for the game

      • getDirection

        public int getDirection()
        A getter method for the private variable direction This method allows other objects to know what direction the player is facing as well.
        Returns:
        the direction the player is facing

      • setLooked

        public void setLooked(boolean choice)
        A setter method that allows altercation to the private variable hasLooked This allows other objects (specifically the GUI) to change the status of hasLooked
        Parameters:
        choice - false if you haven't looked true if you have looked.

      • getLooked

        public boolean getLooked()
        A getter method that returns the status of hasLooked. This tells whether or not the player has looked this turn.

      • getDebug

        public boolean getDebug()
        A getter method for the private variable debug. This will tell whether or not debug mode is on or off.
        Returns:
        whether or not debug mode is on or off

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean mod)
        A setter method that allows the player to toggle debug mode When true, debug mode will be on and the player can see the whole map When false, player can only see 2 spaces in the direction that they are looking.
        Parameters:
        mod - whether or not debug mode is on or off

      • getRadarStatus

        public boolean getRadarStatus()
        A getter method for the private boolean hasRadar. This method will tell other classes if the player in the grid has the radar.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the player has the radar power-up.

      • getInvincible

        public int getInvincible()
        A getter method for the private variable invincible This allows other classes to access invincible and determine how many turns their invincibility will last
        Returns:
        the number of turns your invincibility will last

      • getGun

        public Gun getGun()
        A getter method that allows access to the gun object within a gameEngine object This is useful for getting the amount of bullets remaining in the gun.
        Returns:
        The gun in the game engine

      • setHardMode

        public void setHardMode(boolean mode)
        A setter method that allows the user to change the difficulty. The difficulty can only be changed through this method. This can also be used to toggle the two difficulties.
        Parameters:
        mode - the difficulty that the game will be. True for hard mode, false for easy mode

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin()
        A getter method that checks if you have won the game or not. You win the game when you reach the briefcase. This method returns true when you have won the game and returns false when you are still playing the game.
        Returns:
        Whether or not you have won the game

      • checkAlive

        public boolean checkAlive()
        A getter method that checks if you are alive or dead This method returns true if you are alive This method returns false if you are dead
        Returns:
        whether or not you are alive

      • getGrid

        public Grid getGrid()
        A getter method that allows access to the grid within the game engine
        Returns:
        The grid inside the game engine

      • getMode

        public boolean getMode()
        A getter method that checks if hard mode is on or off If hard mode is on the ninjas have advanced AI and will follow the player
        Returns:
        the game mode

      • checkMoved

        public boolean checkMoved()
        A getter method that checks if the player has moved or not. Returns true if the player has already moved. Returns false if the player hasn't moved.
        Returns:
        whether or not the player has moved

      • checkInvincible

        public void checkInvincible()
        A method that checks if you are invincible If the player is invincible then the invincibility counter will decrease by one until it reaches 0

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        Kills an enemy if the enemy is shot The player is prompted to shoot in a certain direction as well. The gun canno shoot if the ammo is 0. Instead a warning message will appear.

      • shootRight

        public void shootRight()
        Checks for an enemy in the same row and to the right of your current location Shoots and kills the enemy if there is an enemy

      • shootLeft

        public void shootLeft()
        Checks for an enemy in the same row and to the left of your current location Shoots and kills the enemy if there is an enemy

      • shootUp

        public void shootUp()
        Checks for an enemy in the same column and to the above of your current location Shoots and kills the enemy if there is an enemy

      • shootDown

        public void shootDown()
        Checks for an enemy in the same column and to the below of your current location Shoots and kills the enemy if there is an enemy

      • look

        public void look()
        A method that changes the direction that player is looking. If the player has already looked then they will get a warning message

      • lookGui

        public void lookGui()
        A method that is used for changing the direction the player is looking for the GUI If the player has already looked then they will get a warning message

      • enemiesMove

        public void enemiesMove(boolean hardMode)
        Prerequisite: Player must have moved A method that causes all enemies to move. Sets hasMoved to false at the end, signaling that the player may move again
        Parameters:
        hardMode - the difficulty of the game

      • enemiesMoveAI

        public void enemiesMoveAI()
        The AI for the enemies when hard mode is turned on. The enemies will check to see if there are any players in the same row or columns as them. If there are then the enemies will move toward the player. The enemies cannot see through rooms though.

      • playerMove

        public void playerMove(int choice)
        A method that chooses allows the player to move in one direction once hasMoved will become true if the player was able to move The player cannot move through walls or out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        choice - -Determines which way the player will move. 1)Up 2)Down 3)Left 4)Right

      • checkForEnemies

        public void checkForEnemies()
        Prerequisite: The player has already moved A method that checks if there are enemies adjacent to the player If there are enemies the player will die

      • respawn

        public void respawn()
        A method that causes the player to respawn back at [8][0] The player will also lose a life and will be informed of this loss. If the player runs out of lives, the game will end and the player will be informed that they lost.
        Parameters:
        playerRow - The player's current row
        playerCol - The player's current location

      • inBounds

        public boolean inBounds(int x,
                        int y)
        Parameters:
        x - The first value that you are checking
        y - The second value that you are checking
        Returns:
        true if the sum of x and y are greater than -1 and less than 9 A method that makes sure that objects don't go out of bounds

      • checkForPlayer

        public void checkForPlayer(int index,
                           int rowMod,
                           int colMod)

      • checkAhead

        public boolean checkAhead(int modRow,
                          int modCol)
        Parameters:
        modRow -
        modCol -
        Returns:
        true if you can move

      • checkBrief

        public void checkBrief(int modRow,
                       int modCol)
        A method that checks if the briefcase is in the room or not If the briefcase is in the room, the player wins and the game is over. Checking for a brifcase doesn't take up a turn.
        Parameters:
        modRow -
        modCol -

      • isHasMoved

        public boolean isHasMoved()
        A getter method for the private variable hasMoved This allows other objects to determine whether or not the player has moved.
        Returns:
        true if the player has moved and false if the player hasn't moved

      • setHasMoved

        public void setHasMoved(boolean hasMoved)
        A setter method for the private variable hasMoved This allows other objects to set whether or not the player has moved.
        Parameters:
        hasMoved - sets whether or not the player has moved
